title: Principle underlying the Bill of Rights

content.question: Which of the following is a principle underlying the Bill of Rights?

choices.label: The people should control all aspects of governance.
Some rights are fundamental and should not be subject to majoritarian control.
The legislature should be the most powerful branch of government.
All people should be guaranteed the same rights, whether they are citizens or not.
It is groups rather than individuals that have fundamental rights and immunities.

content.answer: Some rights are fundamental and should not be subject to majoritarian control.

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Describe political principles, institutions, processes, policies, and behaviors.
